page.title: 11Timber Framed Cottages.
page.content: In Harvington in the old part of the village there are lots of black and white timber framed houses.We visited one called Firbank. In nineteen forty eight it was modernised.There is a main house and a stable which is now a kitchen.The main building was built four hundred years ago. It used to be called Ingram's Place,and some people think it may have been an inn called The White Hart. There are several other thatched cottages nearby. We interviewed Timothy Davis,a boy at our school,who lives in a thatched cottage.His home is five hundred years old.It has not been rethatched for many years. It is cool in the summer and warm in the winter.It has wire over the thatch to protect it from the birds.There are hooks in the loft to keep the roof on. There is also a large bread oven.
